basics.name: Peter Hall
basics.summary: Cryptographer and tech+science writer based in Brooklyn, NY.

publications.name: The Generalized Riemann Hypothesis and Applications to Primality Testing
publications.publisher: University Scholar Thesis, University of Connecticut
publications.summary: I present an exposition of the Generalized Riemann Hypothesis and describe its applications to primality testing as part of my undergraduate thesis project.

publications.name: Nonmalleable Digital Lockers and Robust Fuzzy Extractors in the Plain Model
publications.summary: We build VBB obfuscation for multi-bit output point functions in order to construct robust fuzzy extractors without the use of a common reference string.

publications.name: Random Oracle Combiners: Breaking the Concatenation Barrier for Collision-Resistance
publications.summary: We build short combiners for hash functions, where the output is collision-resistant assuming one input is a random oracle (and the other is potentially maliciously constructed).

publications.name: Community Norms as Self-Regulation of Generative AI in Creative Industries
publications.summary: We give technical reasoning for the differences between AI and previous forms of automation with respect to work in creative industries.

publications.name: Towards Permissionless Consensus in the Standard Model: Agreement via Fine-Grained Complexity
publications.summary: We use fine-grained assumptions about the orthogonal vectors problem in order to build permissionless consensus without random oracles. Assuming sub-exp DDH, we extend this to a more efficient construction.

publications.name: HELP: Everlasting Privacy through Server-Aided Randomness
publications.summary: Assuming servers which dole out periodically refreshing random seeds, we show how to send messages with everlasting privacy.

publications.name: The Pitfalls of “Security by Obscurity” and What They Mean for Transparent AI
publications.publisher: 39th Annual AAAI Conference on Artificial Intelligence – AAAI 2025, Social Impact Track
publications.summary: We compare the arguments around obscuring AI research and development with similar historical arguments around security in order to better understand the importance of transparent AI.

publications.name: Random Oracle Combiners: Merkle-Damgård Style
publications.summary: We extend our previous results on random oracle combiners to Merkle-Damgård transformations of random oracles using a subtle technical argument.

publications.name: A Meta-Complexity Characterization of Quantum Cryptography
